RECORD.TEXT: 173906547 4047430 943713 5/14/1999 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Unsigned Report Status : Unsigned DISCHARGE SUMMARY GURNEPASCCAUGH , NIA L UNIT NUMBER : 990-30-76 ADMISSION DATE : 05/14/1999 DISCHARGE DATE : 05/23/1999 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSIS : 2. Congestive heart failure . 3. Chronic renal failure , hemodialysis dependent . 5/18/99 Coronary artery bypass graft using the left internal mammary artery to the left anterior descending , saphenous vein graft to the posterior descending artery and posterior left ventricular artery and the saphenous vein graft to the diagonal artery . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 64-year-old woman with accelerating angina pectoris , who had a cardiac catheterization at Chimass Community Hospital revealing three-vessel disease . The patient was transferred to Ph University Of Medical Center for a cardiac surgical evaluation . The patient 's cardiac history has been known for several years . In 05/96 , the patient had a cardiac catheterization that revealed a moderate right coronary artery ostial lesion , severe lesion at the ostial PLV , 50-60% circumflex lesion , 40% proximal left anterior descending , and severe proximal D1 . She had a repeat cardiac catheterization at Chimass Community Hospital on 5/13/99 , which showed three-vessel disease , including right coronary artery 70% ostial , left anterior descending 70% , circumflex 100% . Her ejection fraction was estimated at 60% . There was 1 mitral regurgitation . The patient was transferred to the Ph University Of Medical Center . HOSPITAL COURSE : The bypasses are listed above . The bypass time was 2 hours , 19 minutes , cross-clamp time was 1 hour , 36 minutes . The patient received 3 units of packed red blood cells . She received 1 unit of normal saline . Postoperatively , the patient was taken to the Surgical Intensive Care Unit . Her sedation was weaned and she was extubated as per protocol . The patient was weaned off her pressors and was transferred from the Surgical Intensive Care Unit to the Goman 12 Mini-Unit on postoperative day 1 . 1. Cardiovascular : The patient 's postoperative course was routine . Prior to her transfer to the Goman 12 Unit , her last cardiac index in the Surgical Intensive Care Unit had been between 2.0 and 2.2 . The patient was dialyzed , as stated above , and had fluid taken off in order to approach her preoperative weight . At the time of discharge , the patient 's weight was approximately 173 pounds with a preoperative weight of 156 pounds . Her hematocrit was 26.9 . Her creatinine was 4.2. 3 . The patient was followed by the Diabetes / Endocrine Service . Her NPH and regular insulin doses were adjusted accordingly . Her regular insulin consisted of insulin sliding scale . 4. Infectious Disease : The patient was thought to have had rigors during one of her dialysis sessions . As such , the patient was given Vancomycin and Gentamicin for levels . As such , antibiotics should not be continued . It should be pointed out , however , that a urinalysis from 5/14/99 showed positive white blood cells . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : NPH insulin 8 units subq q PM before dinner . Aspirin 81 mg. PO QD . Phoslo 6 mg. PO TID . Tylenol 650 mg. PO q 6 h PRN pain . The office will call the patient in approximately three to four weeks to see him . The patient should also follow up with Dr. Cord of Cardiology . The patient should also follow up with Dr. Lishdail , her Renal Specialist . OTESA KOTEVI , M.D. TR : rc DD : TD : 05/22/1999 10:06 A cc :
